Package cz.praguecityuniversity

Class IPProtocol

java.lang.Object
cz.praguecityuniversity.IPProtocol
public class IPProtocol
extends java.lang.Object
Responsible for routing events

  • Constructor Details

    • IPProtocol

      public IPProtocol​(cz.praguecityuniversity.TypeofEntity typeofEntity)

  • Method Details

    • createRoutingTable

      public void createRoutingTable()
      Defines routing table as an empty hashmap for router. For computer, the routing table is set to null, i.e., it's disabled.

    • addStaticRoute

      public void addStaticRoute​(int portInterfaceIndex, IPAddress networkIPAddress, EthernetNetworkAdapter ethernetNetworkAdapter) throws InvalidPortInterface, InvalidIPAddress
      Adds static route to the routing table. The static route is a mapping of network IP address with port interface index.
      Parameters:
      portInterfaceIndex - Index of port interface from the array of port interfaces
      networkIPAddress - IP address of the network
      ethernetNetworkAdapter - Ethernet network adapter of the device
      Throws:
      InvalidPortInterface - Thrown when the given port interface is not defined on the device.
      InvalidIPAddress - Thrown when the given network IP address is already assigned to another port.

    • removeStaticRoute

      public void removeStaticRoute​(IPAddress networkIPAddress) throws InvalidIPAddress, EmptyRoutingTable
      Removes static route from routing table.
      Parameters:
      networkIPAddress - Network IP address of the route to be removed.
      Throws:
      InvalidIPAddress - Thrown when the given network IP address is not in routing table.
      EmptyRoutingTable - Thrown when the routing table is empty.

    • getCorrectPortInterface

      public int getCorrectPortInterface​(IPAddress destinationIPAddress, Device device) throws RouteNotFound
      Does routing and gets correct port interface index for redirecting event.
      Parameters:
      destinationIPAddress - IP address of the end device
      device - Device on which the routing is done
      Returns:
      Returns 0 if the device is computer, otherwise returns the corresponding port interface index of the router.
      Throws:
      RouteNotFound - Thrown when the given destination IP address is not found in the routing table.

    • processFinalEvent

      public Event processFinalEvent​(Event event, EventLogger logger, Device device) throws EventFinished
      Checks if the event message is a ping or a regular message. If it's a ping the message is received by the device and redirected to the source device, otherwise the message is received and the event ends.
      Parameters:
      event - Event
      logger - Logger for logging information related to event processing
      device - Device on which the event is processed
      Returns:
      Returns processed event.
      Throws:
      EventFinished - Thrown when the event is finished.
